thread.title: Ricky Gervais forced to leave stage after health scare: 'I thought I was having a heart attack'
thread.title_full: Ricky Gervais forced to leave stage after health scare: 'I thought I was having a heart attack'

author: Jennifer ruby
title: Ricky Gervais forced to leave stage after health scare: 'I thought I was having a heart attack'
text:
Ricky Gervais forced to leave stage after health scare: ‘I thought I was having a heart attack’ 
The British comedian left his Bristol stand-up for 10-minutes after falling ill Thursday 23 February 2017 17:55 GMT Click to followES Entertainment Health scare: Ricky Gervais was forced to leave the stage during a gig Kevin Winter/Getty Images 
Ricky Gervais was forced to leave stage mid-show as he suffered a health scare. 
The comedian took a 10-miniute break during his performance at Bristol’s Colston Hall on Wednesday night, later saying that he feared he was suffering a heart attack. 
He soon returned to finish the gig, reassuring fans in the audience that he ‘wasn’t dead’. 
Worried fans tweeted the Life on the Road star after the show, clearly concerned about his health. Thanks to the amazing audience in Bristol tonight. They even laughed when I thought I was having a heart attack. #Humanity . pic.twitter.com/BtTg8Y8p4w — Ricky Gervais (@rickygervais) February 22, 2017 Have a peaceful night. — Ricky Gervais (@rickygervais) February 22, 2017 I don't think I died, but I'm not a doctor. pic.twitter.com/Sz550RRtM0 — Ricky Gervais (@rickygervais) February 23, 2017 
“Thanks to the amazing audience in Bristol tonight. They even laughed when I thought I was having a heart attack. #Humanity,” he joked on Twitter after the show. 
The next morning he posted a selfie on his Twitter account, writing: “I don't think I died, but I'm not a doctor.” Is this Ricky Gervais' funniest interview yet? 
Responding to a number of fans, Gervais said that he was ‘absolutely fine’, adding that it ‘certainly wasn’t part of the show.” 
He later posted a snap of some Day Nurse, saying that he had been struck down my come kind of sickness bug. David Brent: Life On The Road David Brent: Life On The Road 1/12 Entertaining

“Think I've got a little bug of some sort. Blocked up, bit hot, sore stomach. Also I'm foaming at the mouth and terrified of water. Weird,” he wrote. Read more
